thread.title: Pep Guardiola defends under-fire Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger - 'the way he has been treated is unacceptable'
thread.title_full: Pep Guardiola defends under-fire Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger - 'the way he has been treated is unacceptable'

author: mirror
title: Pep Guardiola defends under-fire Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger - 'the way he has been treated is unacceptable'
text:
City drew 0-0 with the Championship side after the 46-year-old Catalan made eight changes. 
Asked if he felt he should have picked a stronger team, Guardiola said in a press conference: "My friend, I take the decisions, you analyse my decisions. 
"You have to take a decision before, to (find) the best solution (and) it was what I did. If you don't agree, you can write it. Arsene Wenger has come under fire (Photo: Getty) 
"What I hear in the last 10 days, about how people, ex-players, journalists treat Arsene Wenger is unacceptable. 
"Our job, in that moment, doesn't have any respect for any position, so it is unrespectable, what happened. 
"That is why we take the decisions and you can say whatever you want." poll loading What should Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger do? 9000+ VOTES SO FAR
